revised_title: TRH's Photopic Action on Cat Retinal Ganglion Cells
tldr: The study investigates the effects of thyrotropin-releasing hormone (TRH) on cat retinal ganglion cells under photopic conditions. The results show that TRH differentially affects on- and OFF-center cells, suppressing the maintained activity and light response in ON-center cells and enhancing it in OFF-center cells. This suggests that TRH may play a role in light adaptation.
